title: In Liberated Ukrainian City of Kherson, Ecstasy Gives Way to Despair
description: Kherson has been whipsawed by occupation, liberation and now dread. It’s a lonely place. And cold.

title: What to Know About Iran’s Morality Police
description: A top official suggested over the weekend that the unit, responsible for enforcing the country’s strict dress code, had been shut down, though there has not been any government confirmation.

title: Peru’s President Pedro Castillo Faces Impeachment Attempt
description: The president of Peru, Pedro Castillo, faces a third impeachment attempt in Congress, the latest crisis for the leader who rose to power promising to address the country’s chronic inequality.

title: Putin Signs Law Banning Expressions of LGBTQ Identity in Public
description: The law makes it illegal to spread “propaganda” about “nontraditional sexual relations” in all media, including social, advertising and movies.

title: Despite Sanctions, Russian Cruise Missiles Were Made Recently
description: Weapons investigators in Kyiv found that at least one Russian Kh-101 cruise missile used in widespread attacks there on Nov. 23 had been made no earlier than October.

title: Putin Inspects Crimean Bridge Partially Destroyed By Explosion
Cyril Ramaphosa Unlikely to Face Impeachment in South Africa
description: Executives of the governing party, the African National Congress, said on Monday they would instruct their legislators to reject a report suggesting Cyril Ramaphosa might have broken the law.

title: EU Embargo of Russian Oil and G7’s Price Cap Take Effect
description: An immediate impact on oil supplies in Europe was not expected, partly because the embargo has been in the works for months.

title: What to Know About Iran’s Morality Police
description: A top official suggested over the weekend that the unit, responsible for enforcing the Islamic Republic’s strict dress codes, had been shut down, though there has not been any government confirmation.

title: Sudan Military and Pro-Democracy Coalition Sign Peace Deal
description: The agreement, which was boycotted by some political forces, comes more than a year after a coup that scuttled the country’s transition to democratic rule.

title: China Stems Wave of Protest, but Ripples of Resistance Remain
description: Students, residents, lawyers and workers are still challenging the country’s Covid-19 restrictions, even though the intensity of the political chants has been dialed back.

title: Blasts Reported at 2 Military Bases Deep Inside Russia
description: The cause of the explosions was unclear. Some Russian news outlets report that one blast struck an air base that Ukraine says has been used as a staging ground for bombers attacking its energy grid.

title: The End of a Presidential Launchpad
description: Democrats stripped Iowa of its first-in-the-nation status.

title: Brussels Terrorist Attack Trial Opens, Reviving Painful Memories
description: The proceedings against 10 men linked to the 2016 bombings at an airport and a subway station are the largest ever organized in Belgium and are expected to last up to eight months.

title: ‘Important Step’ Toward Addressing Toxic Legacy of Huge Mine
description: Residents of the Papua New Guinea have accused the mining company Rio Tinto of violating their human rights by despoiling the land where they live.

title: He returned a dazed soldier to the Russians. Ukraine calls it treason.
Photos: Indonesia’s Mount Semeru Erupts, Displacing Nearly 2,000
description: When the volcano erupted late last year, more than 50 people were killed, and hundreds more were injured.

title: China Protests Raise Hopes of Activists Abroad
description: People opposing Beijing over issues like Hong Kong, Taiwan or the persecution of Uyghurs see the moment as an opportunity to find common cause.

title: Skyrocketing Prices in Turkey Hurt Families and Tarnish Erdogan
description: Annual inflation is around its highest level in decades, devaluing salaries and devouring savings less than a year before President Recep Tayyip Erdogan runs for re-election.

title: Skyrocketing Prices in Turkey Hurt Families and Tarnish Erdogan
description: Annual inflation is at its highest level in decades, devaluing salaries and devouring savings less than a year before President Recep Tayyip Erdogan runs for re-election.

title: Her Baby Needs Heart Surgery. But She Is Demanding ‘Unvaccinated’ Blood.
description: New Zealand’s health service is seeking to take temporary custody of a critically ill infant so it can perform a lifesaving operation.

title: Russia’s Economy Is Threatened by War and Sanctions
description: While Russia’s economy has not collapsed, an exodus of Western companies is eroding hard-won progress, and experts say the worst may be yet to come.
